jma::JMA_Knowledge

jma::JMA_Knowledge Class Reference

JMA_Knowledge manages the linguistic information for Japanese morphological analysis. More...

Detailed Description

JMA_Knowledge manages the linguistic information for Japanese morphological analysis.

Definition at line 38 of file jma_knowledge.h.

Member Typedef Documentation

typedef std::map<std::string, MorphemeList> jma::JMA_Knowledge::DecompMap

The map to decompose user defined noun.

The key of the map is the user defined noun, such as "本田総一郎", the value of the map is a list of decomposed morphemes, such as "本田", "総一郎", the decomposed morpheme includes Morpheme::lexicon_ and Morpheme::readForm_, if Morpheme::readForm_ is an empty string, no read form is defined.

Definition at line 48 of file jma_knowledge.h.

virtual int jma::JMA_Knowledge::encodeSystemDict ( const char *  txtDirPath,
const char *  binDirPath,
EncodeType  binEncodeType 
) [virtual]

Encode the system dictionary files from text to binary file.

Parameters:
txtDirPath the directory path of text files
binDirPath the directory path of binary files
binEncodeType the encoding type of binary system dictionary
Returns:
0 for fail, 1 for success
Precondition:
both txtDirPath and binDirPath are assumed as the directory paths that already exists. If any of the directory paths does not exist, 0 would be returned for fail.
int jma::JMA_Knowledge::getBaseFormOffset (  )  const

Get the feature offset of base form indexed from zero.

For example, if an entry in dictionary file contains the features like "動詞,自立,*,*,一段,未然形,見る,ミ,ミ", the feature offset of base form "見る" would be 6.

Returns:
the feature offset

int jma::JMA_Knowledge::getNormFormOffset (  )  const

Get the feature offset of normalized form indexed from zero.

For example, if an entry in dictionary file contains the features like "名詞,固有名詞,人名,姓,*,*,渡邊,わたなべ,ワタナベ,渡辺", the feature offset of normalized form "渡辺" would be 9.

Returns:
the feature offset

int jma::JMA_Knowledge::loadDict (  )  [virtual]

Load the dictionaries, which are set by setSystemDict() and addUserDict().

Returns:
0 for fail, 1 for success
Precondition:
the directory path of system dictionary should be set by setSystemDict().
if any user dictionary file need to be loaded, the file name should be added by addUserDict().

int jma::JMA_Knowledge::loadStopWordDict ( const char *  fileName  )  [virtual]

Load the stop-word dictionary file, which is in text format.

The words in this file are ignored in the morphological analysis result.

Parameters:
fileName the file name
Returns:
0 for fail, 1 for success

Implements jma::Knowledge.

Definition at line 543 of file jma_knowledge.cpp.

Referenced by main().

int jma::JMA_Knowledge::setKeywordPOS ( const std::vector< std::string > &  posVec  )  [virtual]

Set the part-of-speech tags as keywords.

If this method is not called or posVec is empty, the results of Analyzer::runWith*() would contain all words. Otherwise, if posVec is not empty, the results of Analyzer::runWith*() would only contain the words with part-of-speech tags specified by this method.

Parameters:
posVec the vector of part-of-speech tags in alphabet format, such as "NC-G"
Returns:
the number of part-of-speech tags successfully set
Attention:
This method should be called after loadDict(), otherwise no keyword part-of-speech tag would be set

Implements jma::Knowledge.
